attributes.action: withdraw the anonymity of Jon Venables, if he is charged over the "extremely serious allegations" he faces, and which have been acknowledged in the press by  Justice Secretary, Jack Straw.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In 1993, then aged 10, Jon Venables was found guilty of participating in the murder of a young child, James Bulger.  

After being released from custody on license in 2001, he has been living under an assumed identity, which the authorities have kept secret from the public.

As has been widely reported in the press, Venables has recently been returned to prison for breaching the terms of his licence.

The purpose of this petition is to request that if, as has been suggested, he faces charges for a serious criminal offence, his right to continued anonymity should be withdrawn.

If as an adult, Jon Venables faces serious criminal charges, his identity should be revealed to the public.

reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
